intro: Gnaphalium aureofulvum, commonly known as golden ragwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in summer, and the plant produces small, oblong seeds that are dispersed by the wind. It is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, adapted to thrive in poor soils.
